subject: Technology
title: Epigenetics: Beyond the Genetic Code
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Epigenetics: Beyond the Genetic Code.

hook.text: Identical twins have the same DNA. Yet one might get cancer and the other won't. Epigenetics explains why.

buildup.text: Epigenetics studies how genes get switched on and off without changing DNA itself. Think of it as software on genetic hardware.

discovery.text: Diet, stress, and environment can add chemical tags to DNA that silence or activate genes, sometimes for life.

twist.text: Some epigenetic changes pass to the next generation. A grandmother's famine can affect her grandchildren's metabolism.

climax.text: Epigenetics shows that nature vs nurture is a false choice. Your environment literally reshapes how your genes work.

punchline.text: Your genes are the script. Your life experience decides which lines get read.

quiz.question: What does epigenetics study?
options: How genes are turned on and off without changing the DNA sequence
